requires the board of higher education to submit a report detailing the status of **ai education** in illinois universities.

Bill_Number: HB 2655 – AI in Higher Education Report
Summary: mandates the board of higher education to report on the status of **ai education and development** in illinois colleges and universities, including programs and research, to inform future policy.

Bill_Number: HB 3021 - SB 1792 – Bot and Avatar Consumer Fraud
Summary: expands the consumer fraud act to make it unlawful for a business to use a **chatbot, ai avatar, or similar ai agent** to interact with consumers in a commercial transaction without clearly disclosing it is not human.

Bill_Number: HB 3334 – HUBZone Center of Excellence (uses AI)
Summary: creates a development center to aid underserved business communities (hubzones), explicitly calling for use of **ai systems to facilitate proposals and improve transparency** in grant processes.

Bill_Number: HB 3503 – Curriculum Review to Add AI
Summary: requires the state board of education to review mandated school curricula every 5 years and consider adding **emerging topics like digital citizenship and ai** if needed, ensuring k-12 education keeps pace with ai issues.

Bill_Name: Ai Safety And Security Protocol Act
Summary: requires ai developers to publicly implement robust **safety protocols** and undergo third-party audits.

Bill_Number: HB 3506 – “AI Safety and Security Protocols” Act
Summary: imposes obligations on ai developers to implement **safety and security protocols**, publish regular risk assessment reports (quarterly) about their ai systems, and undergo annual independent audits of their ai’s safety.

Bill_Number: HB 3529 – AI Governance Principles and Disclosure Act
Summary: requires the department of innovation & technology to adopt **ai governance rules** for businesses, including that companies using ai systems must publish a report on how they uphold specified ai governance principles (fairness, transparency, etc.), with civil penalties for non-compliance.
prohibits state agencies from using **ai-driven automated decisions** without continuous human oversight and detailed impact assessments.

Bill_Number: HB 3567 - HB 3720 – “Meaningful Human Review of AI Act”
Summary: prohibits state agencies from using any automated decision-making system **without meaningful human review** in their functions. requires agencies to perform impact assessments before deploying ai for decisions and ensures a human can override ai.

Bill_Name: Generative Ai Task Force Meetings Act
Summary: allows hybrid meetings and mandates periodic reports by the state's **generative ai task force**

Bill_Number: HB 3646 - SB 2117 – Generative AI Task Force Meetings
Summary: adjusts the generative ai and nlp task force operations (created earlier) to allow **hybrid meetings** and requires it to file reports on its investigation into generative ai. (this is an administrative update to an existing task force.)
requires ticket sellers to show the full price up front and explicitly forbids the use of **ai-driven dynamic pricing** for event tickets (declaring such practice an unfair act).

expands the definition of cyber-bullying in schools to include sharing **“ai digital replicas”** (deepfakes) of students in a sexual context. defines generative ai and prohibits this behavior in schools.

Bill_Number: HB 496 / SB 456 / SB 971 – AI Video Interview Act Amendments
Summary: makes technical amendments to illinois’ existing ai video interview act (which governs use of ai in hiring interviews). (these bills do not change substantive rules but keep the law updated; .)

requires the state it department to establish comprehensive **policies for ai use by state agencies** by 2028. until those rules are in place, agencies are generally prohibited from deploying ai. mandates impact reports for any agency ai usage.
requires disclosure in **ai-generated political advertisements** to prevent voter deception.

amends the criminal impersonation law to clarify that impersonating someone through **ai-generated means** is illegal (e.g. using ai deepfake to falsely represent oneself as another person can be charged as impersonation).
creates state standards for integrating **ai in school curricula** and mandates annual district reporting on ai use.
prohibits school districts from using ai tools to perform teacher performance evaluations; evaluations must be done by human evaluators without **ai scoring of teachers**.
requires **generative ai systems** to warn users prominently about potential inaccuracies or inappropriate outputs.

requires any **generative ai system** (e.g. large language model) to display a clear warning to users that its outputs may be inaccurate or inappropriate. makes failure to include such warning a deceptive business practice under the consumer fraud act.
requires generative ai providers to clearly tag outputs with **metadata tracing content origin** and modifications.

requires providers of generative ai tools to **embed provenance metadata** into any synthetic content they create, and requires social platforms and device makers to preserve and read this data. (similar in concept to florida’s hb 369.)

prohibits real estate lessors from collectively using a third-party **rent price optimization algorithm** (aimed at stopping coordinated rent hikes via shared pricing software). also forbids such software providers from facilitating any “agreement” between landlords on rents.
mandates annual **impact assessments** and transparency disclosures for automated decision-making systems to prevent algorithmic discrimination.
bans use of **ai-powered surveillance data** for discriminatory pricing and wage-setting decisions.

Bill_Number: HB 1296 – School AI Guidelines and Inventory
Summary: directs the department of education to develop model **ai policies for schools** and to maintain an inventory of ai education platforms (with a process for teachers to submit new tools for approval).

Bill_Number: HB 1601 – Quantum and AI Tax Incentives
Bill_Name: Expands Data Center Tax Exemptions To Also Cover Projects Involving **Quantum Computing, Advanced Computing, Ai, And Defense Networks** That Meet Certain Investment Thresholds
Summary: incentivizing high-tech infrastructure.

requires health care providers to **inform patients when ai was used** in any part of their diagnosis, care decisions, or in communications about their health. insurers must similarly disclose any ai use in coverage decisions to insureds.

in a bill on regional economic development funding, it specifies that state investment decisions should align with “endless frontier” priorities including **ai**, ensuring ai is a strategic focus for indiana’s development projects.

allows state agencies to use **ai software for budget preparation** tasks (such as drafting reports), but requires reporting such use to the legislature. also provides measures for reviewing long-vacant positions for possible automation.

Bill_Number: Draft Bill (D 1398) – AI in Campaign Materials
Summary: proposed language to require **disclaimers on ai-generated content** in campaign materials. this would mandate political ads to disclose if ai was used to create any part of the content.

requires iowa's department of education to assist school districts in forming robotics-focused student clubs and authorizes statewide high school athletic associations to sponsor interscholastic robotics competitions.
requires iowa’s teacher preparation programs to include training in **computer science, ai, and computational thinking**, ensuring new educators are versed in ai basics.

Bill_Number: HF 279 - SF 118 – Emergency Powers and AI
Summary: hf 279 prohibits the use of **drones, robots, or ai systems to enforce** emergency or disaster proclamations (preventing autonomous enforcement actions in a state of emergency). meanwhile, sf 118, conversely, would explicitly **authorize** using such technologies in emergency enforcement. (these opposing bills reflect debate on ai in law enforcement during emergencies.)

restricts manufacturers of consumer smart devices from using ai without explicit user notice and an option to disable ai features. establishes a civil right for individuals to sue for damages resulting from violations.

Bill_Number: HF 406 – AI Restrictions and Private Cause of Action
Summary: a broad bill to **restrict certain uses of ai** (exact scope unspecified in summary) and create a private right of action for individuals harmed by prohibited ai uses.

mandates technical assistance from the department of education for schools starting robotics student organizations and authorizes iowa high school athletic bodies to organize competitive robotics events.

Bill_Name: Modifying Elements In The Crimes Of Sexual Exploitation Of A Child, Unlawful Transmission Of A Visual Depiction Of A Child And Breach Of Privacy To Prohibit Certain Acts Related To Visual Depictions In Which The Person Depicted Is Indistinguishable From A Real Child, Morphed From A Real Child'S Image Or Generated Without Any Actual Child Involvement, Provide An Exception For Cable Services In The Crime Of Breach Of Privacy And Prohibit Dissemination Of Certain Items That Appear To Depict Or Purport To Depict An Identifiable Person.
Summary: expands child sexual exploitation and privacy laws to include ai-generated or digitally altered depictions. criminalizes the creation, possession, or distribution of material that depicts real or realistic children in sexual contexts without actual child involvement, and bans sharing fake explicit images purporting to depict real individuals.

Bill_Name: Amends Criminal Statutes To Include **Ai-Created Or Digitally Altered Child Sexual Images** In The Definition Of Illegal Child Pornography And Sexual Exploitation Of A Child.

Prohibiting The Use Of The Artificial Intelligence Platform Deepseek And Other Artificial Intelligence Platforms Controlled By A Country Of Concern On State-Owned Devices And On Any State Network And The Use Of Genetic Sequencers Or Operational Software Used For Genetic Analysis That Is Produced In A Foreign Adversary.
Summary: bans state government employees from using specified foreign-controlled ai platforms on state-issued devices or networks. specifically targets the chinese chatbot ‘deepseek’ and similar ai tools from adversary nations, and also prohibits state use of genetic sequencing technology from those foreign sources, to protect security and data integrity.

Bill_Number: HB 2313 – Ban on Specific AI Platforms in Government
Bill_Name: Prohibits Use Of The Ai Platform **“Deepseek”** (And Other Designated Ai Systems Of Concern) On Any State-Owned Devices Or Networks, Likely Due To Security Or Ethical Concerns.

Defines Criminal “Atmospheric Pollution” (Geoengineering Without Permission) As A Felony And Notes That **Ai Technology** May Be Involved In Such Activities. (These Companion Bills Address Geoengineering, Mentioning Ai As A Tool In That Context.)

Summary: prohibits residential landlords from using algorithmic devices or software to set tenant rent amounts.

Bill_Name: Prohibits Landlords From Using **Algorithmic Pricing Tools** To Determine Rental Rates For Residential Tenants.

Summary: authorizes kentucky courts to pilot ai technology for court proceeding transcription. includes guidelines for the pilot and mandates reporting on the implementation outcomes.
requests the state supreme court to set up a pilot program for courts to use **ai transcription services** in proceedings, under certain guidelines, to evaluate cost and accuracy.
makes unauthorized geoengineering a felony and includes **ai usage** in definitions (same content as hb 22).

Bill_Name: Resolve, Directing The Maine Arts Commission To Study Federal And National Efforts To Protect Artists From Copyright Infringement By Artificial Intelligence Companies And Users And To Monitor Educational Use
Summary: directs the maine arts commission, in consultation with the attorney general, to study ways to protect artists from ai-driven copyright infringement and to monitor the educational use of copyrighted works. the commission must report its findings and any recommended legislation to the legislature’s education committee by december 2025.

Bill_Name: An Act To Prohibit The Use Of Artificial Intelligence In The Denial Of Health Insurance Claims
Summary: establishes requirements for health insurance carriers that use ai in medical utilization review or coverage decisions. beginning january 1, 2026, carriers must ensure ai-driven determinations are fair, transparent, and disclosed, and any denial or modification of health services for medical necessity must be made by a human clinical peer rather than solely by ai.

Bill_Name: An Act To Protect Minors From Harmful Depictions Generated By Artificial Intelligence
Summary: requires parental consent to use a minor’s likeness in advertising and prohibits using ai to generate a specific minor’s image for ads. it creates a right for minors or parents to sue violators and clarifies that ai-generated sexually explicit depictions of minors are prosecutable under existing child pornography laws.

Bill_Name: An Act To Update Processes And Fees In The Probate Court System
Summary: implements various changes to probate law, including raising certain court filing fees and indexing them to inflation. it also requires any probate court document prepared with ai assistance to be accompanied by an affidavit verifying its accuracy, with possible sanctions for noncompliance.

Bill_Name: Resolve, To Study The Effects Of Artificial Intelligence, Cellular Telephones And Social Media On Public Education
Summary: directs the department of education to convene a working group to examine how artificial intelligence, cell phones, and social media are impacting public education. the working group must develop findings and recommendations and report back to the legislature’s education committee.

Bill_Name: An Act To Ensure Determinations Made By The State Are Free From Unethical, Unsafe Or Illegal Interference By Artificial Intelligence
Summary: mandates the state office of information technology to maintain a list of approved ai software for government use and prohibits deploying ai tools unless the state retains control to meet ethical and legal standards. it also guarantees due process by requiring that people affected by an ai-assisted state decision have a way to understand, review, and appeal that decision.

Bill_Name: Health Care Providers And Health Insurance Carriers – Use Of Artificial Intelligence In Health Care Decision Making
Summary: prohibits health care providers and health insurers from using artificial intelligence if it is designed solely to cut costs at the expense of patient care (such as reducing care quality, delaying care, or denying coverage). it also requires providers and carriers that do use ai in health care decision-making to publish annual data about those ai-driven decisions on their websites and to undergo an independent third-party audit of the ai system’s impact on patient care.

Bill_Name: Health Care – Prior Authorizations – Prohibiting Fees
Summary: bars in-network health care providers from charging any fee to obtain prior authorization from an insurer or managed care organization, and prohibits insurers and health plans from using artificial intelligence to automatically deny prior authorization requests. in essence, the bill protects patients by disallowing ai-only denials of medical services and eliminating extra fees for providers seeking approval for treatment.

imposes requirements on developers and deployers of artificial intelligence systems to protect consumers from certain risks. under this bill, an ai system’s developer (offering the system for sale) must provide specified information and disclosures about the ai, and any deployer using a high-risk ai system must implement a risk management policy, conduct impact assessments, and take precautions to prevent algorithmic discrimination. violations would be treated as unfair or deceptive trade practices under maryland’s consumer protection laws.

makes it unlawful to use someone’s **personal identifying information** in ai/deepfake content with intent to harm, and creates a civil cause of action for victims of malicious deepfakes (e.g. non-consensual explicit deepfakes).

Bill_Name: State And Local Agencies – Enforcement Of Federal Immigration Law – Restrictions On Access To Information (Maryland Data Privacy Act)
Summary: known as the maryland data privacy act, this bill compels state and local government agencies (including law enforcement) to deny access to personal data, photographs, and facial recognition searches when requested for federal immigration enforcement purposes, unless a valid court warrant is provided. it strengthens privacy protections by prohibiting information-sharing with federal immigration authorities absent a warrant and requires agencies to report annually on such data requests.

Bill_Name: Consumer Protection – Consumer Reporting Agencies – Use Of Algorithmic Systems
Summary: sets new rules for credit bureaus (consumer reporting agencies) that use algorithmic systems to compile or evaluate consumer credit information. the bill directs the commissioner of financial regulation to establish thresholds for acceptable algorithmic decision-making, require regular training for human reviewers who oversee these algorithms, and put in place a whistleblower protection program, all aimed at ensuring fairness and accountability in algorithm-driven credit reporting.

Bill_Name: Imposes Requirements On Consumer Credit Reporting Agencies That Use **Algorithmic Systems
Summary: mandates certain bias assessment thresholds, human reviewer training, and whistleblower protections to ensure fair ai-driven credit decisions.

Bill_Name: Criminal Law – Child Pornography – Artificial Intelligence Software
Summary: expands the definition of “computer-generated image” in maryland’s child pornography laws to include images created or altered using artificial intelligence software, thereby ensuring that ai-generated child sexual abuse material is treated as illegal under existing child pornography statutes.

Bill_Name: Election Law – Campaign Materials – Disclosure Of Use Of Synthetic Media
Summary: requires any campaign material that contains synthetic media (ai-generated altered images, audio, or video of real individuals or events) to include a clear disclosure stating that the image or recording has been altered or created using computer programs.

Bill_Name: Residential Leases – Use Of Algorithmic Device By Landlord To Determine Rent – Prohibition
Summary: prohibits landlords from using algorithmic devices (such as software using proprietary rental data) to determine the rent charged to residential tenants. a violation is considered an unfair or deceptive trade practice under the maryland consumer protection act, subjecting landlords to penalties.

Bill_Name: Health Insurance – Utilization Review – Use Of Artificial Intelligence
Summary: requires health insurance carriers, pharmacy benefit managers, and private review agents to ensure that any artificial intelligence, algorithm, or software tool used in conducting utilization reviews is implemented in an equitable and non-discriminatory manner. in general, the bill addresses the use of ai in utilization review processes to protect patients from biased or unfair decisions.

Bill_Name: Generative Artificial Intelligence – Training Data Transparency
Summary: mandates that developers of generative artificial intelligence systems (effective for systems released on or after january 1, 2022) publish documentation on their websites detailing the data used to train those ai systems. this transparency measure must be completed by january 1, 2026, and includes information such as data sources, data set size, labeling methods, and whether the data is publicly available or proprietary.

Bill_Name: Consumer Protection – Workgroup On Artificial Intelligence Implementation
Summary: establishes a workgroup on artificial intelligence implementation to study and monitor ai-related issues. the workgroup is tasked with evaluating ai regulation and consumer protection needs, reviewing private-sector ai use and the enforcement authority of the consumer protection division, and must report its recommendations to the general assembly by july 1, 2026.

Bill_Name: Courts – Artificial Intelligence Evidence Clinic Pilot Program – Establishment
Summary: creates an artificial intelligence evidence clinic pilot program within the state court system to provide expertise on ai in legal proceedings. the clinic will assist circuit and district courts by offering expert testimony on whether electronic evidence may have been generated or altered using ai, and the bill authorizes the governor to include funding for the program in the budgets for fy 2027 and 2028.

Bill_Name: State Department Of Education And Department Of Information Technology – Evaluation On Artificial Intelligence In Public Schools
Summary: directs the state department of education, with assistance from the department of information technology, to evaluate the current and potential uses of artificial intelligence in public schools. the evaluation will include a survey of local school systems and a review of available ai-based educational tools, and requires a final report on findings and recommendations by december 15, 2026.

expands election law to ban using **“synthetic media” (ai-generated content)** to fraudulently influence voters’ decisions. (this ensures deepfakes in campaign materials are considered election fraud.)

Bill_Name: Residential Leases – Use Of Algorithmic Device By Landlord To Determine Rent – Prohibition
Summary: prohibits the use of algorithmic pricing tools by landlords in setting residential rents. under this bill, a landlord may not rely on any algorithmic device (especially those using non-public rental market data) to decide how much rent to charge a tenant, and doing so would violate state consumer protection law as an unfair or deceptive practice.

prohibits landlords from using **algorithmic price-setting tools** to determine residential rents. violators are deemed to commit an unfair or deceptive trade practice under maryland’s consumer protection laws.

Bill_Name: Courts – Artificial Intelligence Evidence Clinic Pilot Program – Establishment
Summary: establishes an artificial intelligence evidence clinic pilot program in the maryland court system’s administrative office. the clinic will serve as a resource to provide expert analysis or testimony regarding the authenticity of digital evidence that may have been generated or manipulated by ai, assisting judges and juries in cases where ai-altered evidence is in question. the bill also contemplates specific funding for this program in upcoming fiscal years.

establishes an **ai evidence clinic pilot program** in the state court system, which will provide expert testimony on whether digital evidence was ai-generated or altered. funds are authorized for expert staff to assist courts in authenticating evidence potentially created by ai.

Bill_Number: SB 685 – Limits on Machine Translation in Elections
Summary: requires local election boards to provide language assistance to voters in required languages and **forbids relying solely on machine translation or ai** for translating voting materials (human review is required).

Bill_Name: State Department Of Education And Department Of Information Technology – Evaluation On Artificial Intelligence In Public Schools
Summary: requires a joint effort by the state department of education and department of information technology to evaluate the usage and potential applications of artificial intelligence in maryland’s public schools. the evaluation involves surveying all local school systems and reviewing existing ai tools that support student learning, with a final report on findings due by late 2026.

Bill_Name: Consumer Protection – High-Risk Artificial Intelligence – Developer And Deployer Requirements
Summary: imposes comprehensive obligations on both ai developers and entities that deploy high-risk ai systems to ensure transparency and prevent discriminatory outcomes. the bill requires developers to exercise reasonable care to protect consumers from known or foreseeable algorithmic discrimination, mandates impact assessments and disclosures for high-risk ai, and sets forth consumer protection measures (such as required notices and risk mitigation practices) for the deployment of such ai systems. enforcement authority is granted to the maryland attorney general.

Bill_Name: State And Local Agencies – Enforcement Of Federal Immigration Law – Restrictions On Access To Information (Maryland Data Privacy Act)
Summary: called the maryland data privacy act, this bill restricts state and local agencies from sharing personal data, including photographs or performing facial recognition searches, with federal immigration authorities without a court-issued warrant. it updates privacy laws to compel agencies to deny federal access to databases (such as driver’s license photos or other personal records) for immigration enforcement and requires annual reporting of any such federal requests to the general assembly.

Bill_Name: Artificial Intelligence – Health Software And Health Insurance Decision Making
Summary: requires the maryland health care commission to create a registry of ai-driven health software that is used or offered in the state and bars anyone from distributing or operating such ai health software unless it is registered. additionally, the bill prohibits health insurance carriers from using artificial intelligence to make or influence health care decisions (such as approvals or denials of coverage) directly, aiming to safeguard patient care from unchecked automated decision-making.

Bill_Name: An Act Relative To Ai Health Communications And Informed Patient Consent
Summary: ensures transparency and informed consent when artificial intelligence is used in healthcare. it requires patients to be notified if they receive ai-generated information (and offers a human provider on request), and mandates that health insurers disclose and report any ai algorithms used in processing insurance claims.

Bill_Name: An Act Relative To Preventing Algorithmic Rent Fixing In The Rental Housing Market
Summary: aims to prevent landlords or rental platforms from using algorithms to coordinate or artificially fix rent prices. the bill prohibits algorithm-driven rent-setting practices that could inflate rents or enable collusion in the housing market.

Bill_Name: An Act To Implement The Recommendations Of The Special Commission On Facial Recognition Technology
Summary: implements comprehensive regulations on the use of facial recognition and other biometric surveillance technologies by law enforcement and public agencies. it establishes strict guidelines requiring legal authorization, transparency, and reporting for any use of facial recognition, with limited exceptions (such as certain emergencies or identifying a deceased person).

Bill_Name: An Act To Ensure The Responsible Use Of Advanced Robotic Technologies
Summary: places guardrails on the use of advanced robots and drones to protect public safety and privacy. it bans weaponizing robots and using them to harass or physically restrain people, and requires oversight (like warrants and public reporting) for law enforcement use of robotic devices.

Bill_Name: An Act Fostering Artificial Intelligence Responsibility
Summary: regulates the use of artificial intelligence to ensure it is used responsibly, establishing guidelines and oversight for ai systems.

Bill_Name: An Act Establishing A Special Legislative Commission To Study Load Growth Due To Ai And Data Centers
Summary: creates a special legislative commission to study how the growth of artificial intelligence and data centers is impacting infrastructure (such as energy demand) and to recommend strategies to manage this load growth.

Bill_Name: An Act Regulating Provenance Regarding Artificial Intelligence
Summary: requires providers of ai systems to implement and make available tools to track the provenance of ai-generated content, ensuring transparency about the origin and any modifications of synthetic media.

Bill_Name: An Act To Ensure Accountability And Transparency In Artificial Intelligence Systems
Summary: seeks to ensure that artificial intelligence systems are deployed with clear accountability and transparency measures in place, establishing standards and oversight to prevent misuse and promote openness in ai operations.

Bill_Name: An Act Protecting Consumers In Interactions With Artificial Intelligence Systems
Summary: establishes consumer protections for individuals interacting with ai systems by requiring transparency, fairness, and accountability from ai service providers to prevent harm or unfair outcomes to consumers.
directs the state to promote **responsible ai development** with ethical guidelines. (general proposal to encourage safe ai innovation.)
would regulate **provenance of ai-generated content**, similar to other states’ deepfake labeling bills, ensuring that ai-altered media can be traced or labeled.

Bill_Number: HD 2226 / SD 1203 / SD 1607 – Algorithmic Rent Fixing
Summary: multiple identical bills to prohibit **algorithmic rental price-fixing** in housing markets. targets rent-setting software used by landlords to prevent collusion and unfair rent hikes.

Bill_Number: HD 396 – “An Act to Ensure Accountability and Transparency in AI Systems”
Summary: a comprehensive ai governance bill requiring businesses to **disclose their use of ai systems**, especially those targeting consumers or affecting consumer behavior, and to implement risk mitigation measures.
aims to **protect consumers interacting with ai systems**, likely by requiring disclosures or creating a state ai bill of rights.

Bill_Name: An Act Relative To Preventing Algorithmic Rent Fixing In The Rental Housing Market
Summary: prevents the use of algorithms for rent fixing or collusion among landlords in the housing market. it bans coordinated algorithmic rent-setting practices that lead to artificially inflated rents, ensuring rental prices are determined by fair competition rather than automated collusion.

Bill_Name: An Act To Implement The Recommendations Of The Special Commission On Facial Recognition Technology
Summary: enacts the policy recommendations of a state commission regarding facial recognition technology. it imposes strict controls on law enforcement and public agency use of facial recognition and similar ai-driven identification tools, requiring warrants or explicit authorization and detailed reporting for their use, with narrow exceptions for urgent or specific situations.

Bill_Name: An Act To Ensure The Responsible Use Of Advanced Robotic Technologies
Summary: sets rules for the responsible use of robots and drones to protect the public. this bill bans weaponized or abusive uses of robotic devices (such as attaching weapons or using robots to harass people) and creates oversight requirements, including restrictions and transparency for any law enforcement use of robotics.

Bill_Name: An Act Establishing Protections For Consumers Interacting With Artificial Intelligence Chatbots
Summary: provides legal protections for consumers interacting with ai chatbots. it requires transparency (for example, disclosing when a consumer is conversing with an ai) and implements safeguards to prevent deception, data misuse, or other harms in chatbot interactions.

Bill_Name: An Act Fostering Artificial Intelligence Responsibility
Summary: promotes the responsible use of ai, particularly in workplace settings. for instance, it would protect employee well-being by limiting certain ai-driven electronic monitoring tools and ensuring that workplace ai is used in ways that safeguard workers' health and privacy.

Bill_Name: An Act Promoting Economic Development With Emerging Artificial Intelligence Models And Safety
Summary: aims to boost economic development through emerging ai technologies while ensuring these new ai models are deployed safely. it encourages innovation in the ai sector alongside measures to uphold safety standards and maintain public trust in ai.

Bill_Name: An Act To Establish A Commission To Investigate Ai In Education
Summary: creates a commission to study the impact and use of artificial intelligence in education. the commission will investigate how ai technologies affect schools and learning, and it will report recommendations on managing ai in the education system for the benefit of students and educators.

Bill_Name: An Act Relative To The Use Of Artificial Intelligence And Other Software Tools In Healthcare Decision-Making
Summary: establishes guidelines for how artificial intelligence and software decision-making tools can be used in healthcare. it seeks to ensure that any ai assistance in medical decisions is done under proper oversight and with safeguards to protect patients' health and rights.

Bill_Name: An Act Relative To Cybersecurity And Artificial Intelligence
Summary: enhances state cybersecurity practices and addresses the use of ai in government. the bill mandates annual cybersecurity training for public employees and includes provisions to further regulate ai systems within government operations to ensure public safety and data security.

Bill_Name: An Act Prohibiting Algorithmic Rent Setting
Summary: prohibits the use of algorithmic pricing tools to set rental housing rates in ways that could distort the market. the goal is to stop landlords or companies from leveraging shared algorithms to uniformly raise rents, thereby protecting tenants from unfair rent increases due to algorithm-driven collusion.

Bill_Number: SD 1909 – “Act Promoting Economic Development with Emerging AI Models and Safety”
Summary: seeks to boost **economic development** by supporting emerging ai industries while establishing safety guidelines (possibly funding ai r&d along with safety standards).
proposes to **protect consumers interacting with ai chatbots**, likely by mandating disclosures or giving consumers rights when conversing with ai agents.
limits or sets standards for the use of ai and other software in **healthcare decision-making**, ensuring ai cannot override medical judgment or patient consent.
addresses **cybersecurity risks of ai**, potentially establishing standards or task forces to guard against ai-driven cyber threats.

Bill_Name: Use Of Tenant Screening Software That Uses Nonpublic Competitor Data To Set Rent Prohibited; Use Of Software That Is Biased Against Protected Classes Prohibited
Summary: prohibits the use of tenant screening software that relies on competitors’ private rent data or that is biased against protected classes. the goal is to prevent rent-fixing algorithms and discrimination in housing.

Bill_Name: Study Of Environmental Impacts Of Artificial Intelligence Required; Report Required; And Money Appropriated
Summary: instructs state agencies to study ai’s environmental impacts in minnesota and report the findings. it also provides funding to carry out the study.

Bill_Name: Health Insurance; Use Of Artificial Intelligence Prohibited In The Utilization Review Process
Summary: prohibits health insurers from using artificial intelligence in utilization review (prior authorization) processes. aims to keep medical coverage decisions in human hands and avoid errors or biases from automated systems.

Bill_Name: Robotics Program Grants Authorized; Report Required; And Money Appropriated
Summary: creates a competitive grant program to fund high school robotics teams and requires a report on the program’s outcomes. funding is appropriated to support these grants. the aim is to promote stem education and hands-on learning.

Bill_Name: Artificial Intelligence Use To Dynamically Set Product Prices Prohibited
Summary: outlaws the practice of using ai to adjust or set product prices in real time based on factors like demand or consumer data. the aim is to protect consumers from exploitive dynamic pricing tactics.

Bill_Name: Algorithm And Ai Use Prohibited During Health Insurance Prior Authorization Request Review
Summary: bans health insurers from using algorithms or ai to decide prior authorization requests. this ensures that approval or denial decisions for medical procedures are made by humans rather than automated programs.

Bill_Name: Certain Social Media Algorithms That Target Children Prohibited
Summary: prohibits social media platforms from using algorithms to target content to users under age 18. the goal is to protect minors from harmful targeted content.

Bill_Name: Use Of Facial Recognition Technology As Part Of The Driver’S License And Minnesota Identification Card Application Process Required
Summary: requires the minnesota department of public safety to use facial recognition technology as part of the driver’s license and state id card application process. the purpose is to enhance identity verification and security in issuing ids.

Bill_Name: Environmental Impacts To Minnesota Of Artificial Intelligence Study Requirement And Appropriation
Summary: requires a study on the effects of ai on minnesota’s environment and allocates funding for it. the intent is to understand ai’s environmental footprint and inform future policy.

Bill_Name: Certain Social Media Algorithms Targeting Children Prohibition Provision
Summary: bars social media companies from employing algorithms that curate targeted content for users under 18. this consumer protection measure is intended to safeguard children online.

Bill_Name: Usage Of Artificial Intelligence In The Utilization Review Process Prohibition Provision
Summary: bans the use of ai by health insurers in the utilization review process for medical care approvals. it ensures that human judgment remains central in determining medical necessity for patients.

Bill_Name: Robotics Programs Grants Authorization And Appropriation
Summary: authorizes state grants for school robotics programs and includes a reporting requirement on their implementation. the intent is to invest in stem opportunities for students and foster hands-on learning experiences.

Bill_Name: Individual Communication With Artificial Intelligence Disclosure Requirement Provision
Summary: mandates that businesses or services disclose to users when an individual is interacting with an ai rather than a person. it also requires giving users the option to communicate with a human. the intent is to ensure transparency in ai-driven interactions.

Bill_Name: Use Of Tenant Screening Software That Uses Nonpublic Competitor Data To Set Rent Prohibited
Summary: likewise prohibits landlords from using tenant screening algorithms that utilize nonpublic competitor data to set rents or that have biased outcomes. it is designed to promote fair rental practices and transparency in how rents are determined.

Bill_Name: Prohibition On Using Artificial Intelligence To Dynamically Set Product Prices
Summary: prohibits companies from deploying ai to dynamically adjust product prices based on market factors or consumer behavior. the bill aims to prevent manipulative pricing algorithms and protect consumer fairness.

Bill_Name: "Higher Learning Quantum Computing And Ai Professors Grant Program"
Summary: "would create a state grant program for public universities to establish endowments for recruiting and employing professors in quantum computing and artificial intelligence engineering. status: died in house committee."

Bill_Name: "Artificial Intelligence In Education Task Force Act"
Summary: "creates an ai in education task force to evaluate potential applications of artificial intelligence in k-12 schools and to develop policy recommendations for its responsible and effective use by students and educators. status: passed senate; died in house committee."

Bill_Name: "Its Contracting; Prohibit With Certain Foreign Ai/Software Entities"
Summary: "prohibits the state department of information technology services (its) from contracting with any business entity whose primary purpose is software development or artificial intelligence r&d in mainland china or in countries sanctioned by the u.s. bureau of industry and security. status: died on senate calendar."

Bill_Name: Media Literacy And Critical Thinking Act
Summary: establishes a media literacy pilot program in schools to teach critical thinking about media and the influence of algorithms on information. creates curriculum requirements aimed at improving students’ ability to analyze and understand digital content including social media.

Bill_Number: HB 116 – “Media Literacy and Critical Thinking Act”
Summary: establishes a pilot program in schools to teach media literacy, including understanding **algorithms** behind news feeds and social media.

Bill_Name: Establishes The Ai Non-Sentience And Responsibility Act

Bill_Number: HB 673 – AI in Political Ads Disclaimer

Bill_Name: Prohibits Governmental Entities From Granting Legal Personhood To Artificial Intelligence Or Other Non-Human Entities

Bill_Number: HB 865 – State Tech Task Force on AI
Summary: modifies the existing state technology task force to specifically evaluate **cloud computing and ai** for improving state government services and record management. (focuses on efficiency gains through ai in state agencies.)

Bill_Name: Establishes Provisions Relating To The Civil And Criminal Liability Of Disclosure Of Intimate Digital Depictions

criminalizes creating or distributing **sexually explicit deepfake images** without the depicted person’s consent.

Bill_Name: Generally Revise Usage Of Artificial Intelligence In Certain Health Insurance
Summary: regulates health insurers’ use of ai in managing care and claims decisions. insurers would have to disclose and submit their ai systems for regulatory oversight, preventing coverage from being denied solely by an algorithm and ensuring accountability in automated decision-making​lexisnexis.com.

calls for an interim legislative study on ai, examining how montana should regulate ai and possibly draft a state ai policy for 2026.

Bill_Name: Creating The Right To Compute Act And Requiring Shutdowns Of Ai Controlled Critical Infrastructure
Summary: establishes the "right to compute act" to protect the use of ai technology (for data processing and operations) while imposing safety guardrails. it prohibits harmful ai uses (e.g., deceptive or dangerous acts) and requires that critical ai systems have human override mechanisms in emergencies​ypradio.org​ypradio.org.

Bill_Name: Revise Election Laws Regarding Disclosure Requirements For The Use Of Ai In Elections

requires any election-related material that used ai (for example, ai-generated candidate images or audio) to include a **clear disclosure** of that fact.

Bill_Name: Criminalize Disclosure Of Certain Explicit Ai-Generated Media

Bill_Name: Require Disclosures Of Ai Use By Online Media Manufacturers

a comprehensive bill requiring companies to **disclose “high-risk” ai system usage** in decisions that significantly impact consumers (housing, employment, credit, etc.), perform bias impact assessments, and allowing the attorney general to enforce and consumers to seek injunctive relief for violations.

Bill_Name: Revises Provisions Relating To Pornography Involving Minors.

Bill_Name: Revises Provisions Relating To Artificial Intelligence.

an omnibus education measure that, among other changes, requires the superintendent of public instruction to appoint a committee on the use of artificial intelligence in education. this task force will study and develop guidelines for the incorporation of ai in schools, ensuring oversight and informed policy on ai in the education system.

Bill_Name: Establishes Requirements For Certain Communications Relating To An Election.

Bill_Number: SB 186 – Generative AI Patient Communication Disclosure

Bill_Name: Relating To The Right To Compute. Providing That The Right Of Individuals To Use Computation Resources Shall Not Be Infringed.

Bill_Name: Relative To The Expectation Of Privacy In The Collection And Use Of Personal Information.

Bill_Name: Creating A Public County Registry Of The Monthly Rent Charged By Landlords For Each Owned Unit And Prohibiting Landlords From Using Algorithms Or Software To Determine Rental Rates.

Bill_Name: Ban On Facial Recognition In Housing

Bill_Number: AB 235 – Ban Political Deepfakes of Officials

Bill_Number: AB 3125 – Fair Housing and AI Tools

Summary: establishes an artificial intelligence division within the texas department of information resources to oversee statewide implementation of ai.

Bill_Name: Government Ai And Data Management Regulation
Summary: sets comprehensive guidelines for texas government agencies' use of artificial intelligence and data management, emphasizing transparency, privacy, and ethical standards.

Bill_Name: Criminalizing Ai-Generated Child Sexual Abuse Material
Summary: makes possession or promotion of ai-generated images depicting child sexual abuse explicitly illegal, closing existing loopholes in state law.
creates criminal penalties for producing or distributing political advertising manipulated by generative ai without clear disclosure.

Bill_Name: Ban On Ai Use In Public School Classrooms
Summary: prohibits public schools from employing artificial intelligence technology in classroom instruction, preserving traditional educational practices.

Bill_Name: Civil Liability For Ai-Generated Explicit Material
Summary: creates civil liability for individuals producing or distributing ai-generated explicit images (deepfakes) without the subject’s consent.

Bill_Name: Criminal Penalties For Unauthorized Ai-Generated Explicit Content
Summary: increases criminal penalties for unauthorized production or distribution of sexually explicit ai-generated (deepfake) material, enhancing protections for victims.
requires businesses and agencies to clearly disclose when artificial intelligence systems are involved in decision-making processes or consumer interactions.

Bill_Name: Ai Regulation In Health Insurance Claims
Summary: imposes accountability requirements on health insurers using ai systems for claim processing, ensuring patient protection against adverse automated decisions.
"establishes an artificial intelligence in education task force to guide ai integration in utah's schools and develop related policies."
"modifies government data privacy and oversight laws to include facial recognition and automated decision-making systems under new privacy safeguards."

"creates protections for users of ai mental health chatbots by banning these services from selling personal data or using it beyond providing mental health care. it also requires chatbots to clearly inform users they are ai (not human) and imposes penalties for violations."

Bill_Name: Law Enforcement Usage Of Artificial Intelligence
Summary: "requires each law enforcement agency to establish a policy on generative ai use. also mandates that any police report written with ai assistance include a clear disclaimer and be reviewed for accuracy by the officer."

"limits mandatory upfront ai disclosure to only high-risk chatbot services like legal or medical advice while allowing ai to remain undisclosed unless asked in other cases. companies that fail to comply with these rules can face fines."

"prohibits the use of a person's name or likeness via ai without consent to falsely endorse products or solicit donations. allows victims of such ai impersonation to sue and recover profits made from the misuse of their identity."
"extends the repeal (sunset) date of the utah artificial intelligence policy act from 2025 to july 1 2027. this keeps the state's ai policy office operating for an additional two years."

Bill_Name: An Act Relating To Creating Oversight And Safety Standards For Developers And Deployers Of Inherently Dangerous Artificial Intelligence Systems
Summary: this bill creates new oversight and safety standards for the development and deployment of high-risk ai systems. it seeks to ensure accountability by requiring thorough risk assessments and responsible practices for ai developers and deployers.

Bill_Name: An Act Relating To The Regulation Of Social Media Platforms And Artificial Intelligence Systems
Summary: this bill requires providers of social media platforms and ai systems to register annually with the state and comply with new safety and privacy standards. it includes protections for minors and transparency measures for ai interactions, aiming to prevent harmful practices and ensure accountability.

Bill_Name: An Act Relating To Restricting The Use Of Artificial Intelligence To Affect Rental Housing Pricing And Availability
Summary: this bill would ban collusion and the use of ai-driven algorithms to manipulate rental housing prices or availability. it is intended to protect tenants from algorithmic price-fixing and ensure fair housing market practices.

Bill_Name: An Act Relating To The Use Of Synthetic Media In Elections
Summary: this bill requires clear disclosure when synthetic media (deepfake content) is used within 90 days of an election. it aims to prevent deception of voters by mandating labels on ai-manipulated images, videos, or audio in political content, with penalties for non-compliance.

requires that any recommendation or prediction from an ai-based tool used for criminal justice decisions (such as pretrial release, sentencing, probation, or parole) be reviewed and approved by a qualified human decision-maker. prohibits using ai-generated recommendations as the sole basis for such decisions and allows legal challenges to the use of these tools.

establishes a school safety firearm detection software pilot program as part of the public school security equipment grant initiative. defines 'firearm detection software' as an ai-driven technology that analyzes live video feeds for firearms and immediately alerts law enforcement and school officials when a weapon is detected.

bans the sale of any algorithmic software or service used to set or recommend rental housing prices. aims to prevent automated rent-setting algorithms from influencing rental rates in residential leases, with civil penalties for violations.

requires state and local public bodies to adhere to new standards when developing, procuring, or using 'high-risk' ai systems. directs the state’s chief information officer to establish policies and procedures for high-risk ai in government and convene a work group to study local compliance, with findings reported back.

Bill_Name: State Residential Landlord And Tenant Act
Summary: prohibits landlords from using or incorporating algorithmic pricing tools to determine rent for prospective tenants. initiates a study (with a required report) on the impact of algorithmic rent-setting on the housing market, addressing concerns that such ai-driven pricing could distort competition.

Bill_Name: High-Risk Artificial Intelligence Developer And Deployer Act
Summary: enacts the high-risk artificial intelligence developer and deployer act, which imposes requirements on businesses that create or deploy 'high-risk' ai systems used in consequential decisions (like employment, lending, health care, housing, or insurance). it requires these ai developers and deployers to implement safeguards against algorithmic discrimination, with enforcement by the attorney general and civil penalties for violations.

Bill_Name: Digital Content Authenticity And Transparency Act
Summary: establishes the digital content authenticity and transparency act. requires developers of generative ai services to embed provenance metadata (traceable origin information) into any synthetic digital content they produce and to provide public tools for reading these markers, in order to help distinguish ai-generated media from authentic content.
requires landlords to disclose if they use **ai-driven tenant screening or rent-setting algorithms** and allows tenants to request human review of decisions.

introduces the artificial intelligence training data transparency provisions into virginia’s consumer data protection act. allows consumers to use a single, universal opt-out mechanism (such as a browser setting or extension) to prohibit companies from processing their personal data, including for ai model training.

Bill_Name: Division Of Emerging Technologies, Cybersecurity, And Data Privacy
Summary: creates a division of emerging technologies, cybersecurity, and data privacy within the office of the attorney general. charges this new division with overseeing and enforcing laws related to cybersecurity, data privacy, and the use of ai and other emerging technologies, and requires it to submit an annual report on its activities.

Bill_Name: Unlawful Dissemination Of Intimate Images Of Another
Summary: creates stricter penalties for distributing false intimate images (deepfakes) of someone without consent. establishes a tiered system of criminal charges for the unlawful dissemination of ai-generated or digitally altered intimate images that realistically depict a person.

modifies high school graduation requirements and course options. eliminates the standalone virtual course requirement for graduation and directs the board of education to issue guidelines allowing computer science and artificial intelligence courses to count toward graduation requirements.

Bill_Name: Division Of Consumer Counsel (Ai Fraud And Abuse)
Summary: expands the duties of the state’s division of consumer counsel to address fraud and abuse involving ai. requires the division to set up programs to combat ai-related scams, including a statewide alert system to notify consumers of ai-driven fraud or abuse.

mandates the development of statewide guidelines for law enforcement use of certain technologies. directs the department of criminal justice services to create a comprehensive framework governing police use of ai and machine learning systems, advanced surveillance technologies, and interrogation practices, with standards for both adult and juvenile settings.

Bill_Name: Advanced Registered Medication Aides (Use Of Ai Assistants)
Summary: requires hospitals, nursing homes, and certified nursing facilities to allow patients to use personal ai assistant devices (like voice-activated smart assistants) during inpatient stays. each facility must establish policies to ensure appropriate and safe use of patient-provided ai assistants in accordance with state regulations.

establishes the ai transparency act. requires that any audio, image, text, or video content generated by a generative ai system and made available in the state include a clear and conspicuous disclosure indicating it is ai-generated.

criminalizes the non-consensual distribution of realistic fake intimate images (deepfakes). defines 'intimate image' to include any visual media that is indistinguishable from a real image of a person but is ai-generated or computer-altered, and imposes penalties for offenders.

creates a medicaid billing oversight task force to improve oversight of healthcare billing and credentialing. directs the task force, in partnership with the health department, to implement automated data systems utilizing advanced analytics and machine learning to detect fraud and reduce manual workload in medicaid billing oversight.

bans law enforcement officers from using deceptive or false statements and fake documents during the interrogation of minors. specifically prohibits police from using 'inauthentic' documents generated by ai or other means to mislead juveniles during custodial interrogations.

requires hospitals to include fentanyl screening in any urine drug test conducted to diagnose a patient. also mandates that hospitals, nursing homes, and nursing facilities allow patients to use personal ai assistant devices (such as voice assistants) during their inpatient care, with appropriate policies in place.

Bill_Name: Nursing Homes And Certified Nursing Facilities
Summary: sets new insurance requirements and tech policies for care facilities. increases the minimum professional liability insurance coverage that nursing homes and nursing facilities must carry (and requires that coverage to be non-eroding), and requires hospitals, nursing homes, and similar facilities to establish policies allowing patients to use their own ai-powered personal assistant devices during their stay.

establishes the artificial intelligence transparency act. mirrors house legislation requiring that generative ai systems clearly label all ai-generated audio, visual, or textual content with a conspicuous notice that it is ai-created.

requires virginia state agencies to implement safeguards when using 'high-risk' ai tools. mandates that state public bodies follow defined standards for developing, deploying, and using high-risk ai systems, directs the chief information officer to issue policies for ai procurement and use, and calls for a work group to study local government compliance.

Bill_Name: Threats Report Against Health Care Providers
Summary: requires hospitals to report any threats or acts of violence against health care providers to the department of health and to publish aggregated data quarterly. also compels hospitals, nursing homes, and nursing facilities to allow patients to use personal ai assistant devices during inpatient stays, with policies to regulate their use.

directs each state agency to inventory their **ai systems** and develop governance policies in line with the state’s ai ethics guidelines; establishes an oversight mechanism through the state’s innovation and technology department.

targets deepfake involvement in elections. makes it unlawful to disseminate ai-generated audio or visual media impersonating a candidate in an election without a clear disclaimer, and requires any synthetic political media to start with a conspicuous statement that it is not an authentic recording of the actual candidate.
requires developers of consumer-facing ai systems to publicly disclose the sources and nature of the data used to train their ai models, and imposes a fine (up to $5,000) for failure to comply.

Bill_Name: Concerning Offenses Involving Fabricated Depictions Of Minors.
Summary: expands criminal laws on child exploitation to include 'deepfake' sexually explicit images of minors that are entirely ai-generated, closing a loophole that previously exempted fully fabricated depictions.

Bill_Name: Informing Users When Content Is Developed Or Modified By Artificial Intelligence.
Summary: mandates that providers of large generative ai systems (with over 1,000,000 users) offer a free tool enabling the public to detect whether an image, video, or audio has been created or altered by ai.

Bill_Name: Prohibiting The Knowing Distribution Of A Forged Digital Likeness.
Summary: criminalizes the knowing distribution of ai-generated or digitally altered visual or audio media (a 'forged digital likeness') that impersonates a real person in a manner likely to deceive, effectively extending existing impersonation laws to cover harmful deepfakes.

Bill_Name: Making Improvements To Transparency And Accountability In The Prior Authorization Determination Process.
Summary: prohibits health insurers from using an artificial intelligence tool as the sole basis to deny, delay, or modify a patient’s medical treatment under a prior authorization, ensuring such decisions include human oversight and transparent criteria.

Bill_Name: Allowing Bargaining Over Matters Related To The Use Of Artificial Intelligence.
Summary: gives public sector employees (including state agency and education workers) the right to collectively bargain with employers over the introduction or modification of ai technologies in the workplace when those technologies could impact employees’ job duties, evaluations, or working conditions.

Bill_Name: Addressing Technology Used By Employers In The Workplace.
Summary: regulates employers’ use of electronic monitoring and automated decision-making systems (including ai-driven tools) by requiring advance notice to employees and by prohibiting certain high-risk or biased uses of such technology in the workplace.

Bill_Name: Creating An Artificial Intelligence Grant Program.
Summary: establishes a state-run grant program (the “spark act”) to fund projects that develop or deploy artificial intelligence technologies, with the goal of fostering ai innovation that enhances public safety, government services, and economic development.

Bill_Name: Promoting The Economic Development Of Innovative Uses Of Artificial Intelligence.
Summary: directs state agencies to support the growth of washington’s ai industry by coordinating resources (including the state’s ai task force and technology offices) to foster the development and deployment of innovative ai applications across various sectors of the economy.

Bill_Name: Concerning Sexually Explicit Depictions Of Minors.
Summary: closes a gap in child protection laws by making it a felony offense to create, possess, or distribute pornographic images of minors that are entirely generated by artificial intelligence (with no real child involved), thereby outlawing computer-generated child sexual abuse material.

Bill_Name: Concerning Offenses Involving Fabricated Depictions Of Minors.
Summary: makes it illegal to create or distribute fully ai-generated explicit depictions of children (closing the prior loophole for entirely fabricated child sexual abuse images) and extends the statute of limitations for such offenses from three years to ten years.

Bill_Name: Making Improvements To Transparency And Accountability In The Prior Authorization Determination Process.
Summary: companion to hb 1566, this bill ensures that health insurers cannot rely solely on ai algorithms when making prior authorization decisions for medical treatments, mandating greater transparency and human review in those utilization management processes.

Bill_Name: Allowing Bargaining Over Matters Related To The Use Of Artificial Intelligence.
Summary: companion to hb 1622, this measure allows collective bargaining on employer use of ai in the public sector, empowering public employee unions to negotiate how new or modified ai systems are implemented when they could affect employees’ terms of employment.

Bill_Name: Prohibiting Algorithmic Rent Fixing And Noncompete Agreements In The Rental Housing Market.
Summary: bans the use of algorithm-driven rent-setting software and related data-sharing agreements among landlords that effectively fix rental prices, thereby preventing anti-competitive “algorithmic” rent fixing and protecting fair rental market practices.

requires all public high school students to earn one credit in computer science for graduation. also directs the state education board to set course standards and teacher qualifications for the new requirement.

bars law enforcement and local officials from using certain surveillance and facial recognition ai technologies without safeguards. establishes penalties for violations and creates a private right of action for individuals harmed by unauthorized use.

Bill_Number: HB 3125 – Ban Deepfakes in Election Ads
Summary: would prohibit the distribution of any **ai-generated false video or audio of a candidate** within 30 days of an election with intent to mislead voters.

requires each state agency to submit an annual report listing any **ai or automated decision systems** they use and describing their purpose, to increase transparency in government ai use. *(west virginia’s legislature is part-time; major ai policy might be addressed via interim studies rather than a large number of bills.)*

Bill_Name: Ai High School Elective Course Study
Summary: requests the joint committee on government and finance to study the creation of a high school elective course on artificial intelligence.

prohibits producing or sharing any pornographic depiction of a minor that is generated by ai instead of a real child. possessing such ai-generated child pornography is also criminalized under this bill.
bans the use of ai-generated “deepfake” images or synthetic media to influence elections without clear disclosure. imposes penalties for distributing deceptive ai media in political campaigns.

restricts law enforcement and local agencies from misusing facial recognition and other ai surveillance technologies. establishes standards to ensure any use of these tools respects fourth amendment rights and provides penalties for violations.

prohibits all geoengineering and other deliberate weather modification activities in the state. the ban explicitly includes any such efforts controlled by ai systems and defines key terms (including “artificial intelligence”) with associated penalties for violations.

Bill_Name: Representations Depicting Nudity And Providing A Penalty
Summary: expands state criminal statutes on nudity to include synthetic media created with ai. aims to penalize non-consensual deepfake nude images or videos
